intro: Papualthia bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate papua, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, thriving in cool and humid conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine layer of hair, while the stems are erect and branching. Papualthia bracteata is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native environment.
